required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 3 Study of Bardoxolone Methyl in Patients With Diabetic Kidney Disease; AYAME Study
clinical_study.official_title: RTA 402 Phase 3 Clinical Trial (A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Clinical Trial in Patients With Diabetic Kidney Disease)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate the efficacy of multiple oral doses of RTA 402 (5, 10, or 15 mg) administered once daily in patients with diabetic kidney disease (DKD) using the time to onset of a ≥ 30% decrease in estimated glomerular filtration rate calculated from serum creatinine (eGFR) from baseline or end-stage renal disease (ESRD) as an indicator in a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study; the safety of RTA 402 will also be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to onset of a ≥ 30% decrease in eGFR from baseline or ESRD
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, approximately 2 to 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to onset of a ≥ 40% decrease in eGFR from baseline or ESRD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, approximately 2 to 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to onset of a ≥ 53% decrease in eGFR from baseline or ESRD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, approximately 2 to 3 years
Through study completion, approximately 2 to 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in eGFR from baseline at each evaluation time point
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, approximately 2 to 3 years

arm_group.description: Patients will receive multiple oral doses of bardoxolone methyl once daily. The starting dose of bardoxolone methyl will be 5 mg. The maximum dose will be 15 mg, and the dose will be increased by 5 mg.
Patients randomized to placebo will remain on placebo throughout the study, undergoing sham titration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with DKD
- Mean eGFR ≥ 15 and < 60 mL/min/1.73 m²
- Albumin/creatinine ratio (ACR) ≤ 3500 mg/g Cr
- Treatment with an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor and/or an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) with no change in dosage or medication etc.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes mellitus that is neither type 1 nor type 2
- Decreased renal function mainly attributed to a non-diabetic cause
- History of renal transplantation or upcoming preemptive renal transplantation
- Confirmed mean systolic blood pressure > 160 mmHg or a confirmed mean diastolic blood pressure > 90 mmHg during the 8-week period before screening
- Hemoglobin A1c level > 10.0% during screening
- Serum albumin level ≤ 3.0 g/dL during screening
- Cardiovascular disease specified in the study protocol
- History of cardiac failure
- BNP level > 200 pg/mL during screening etc.

facility.name: Japan Community Health care Organization Sendai Hospital
